intro: Oreocharis obtusidentata, commonly known as the broad-leafed oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its lanceolate, serrated leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
